comments.commentBody: Look, he's an unrepentant war criminal.  Unhappily in this country the judiciary is not independent enough to bring him to justice.  That being said, ignore him.  Don't buy his book, don't give him any respect.  If you see him and his posse of Secret Service, turn your back and stay standing with your back to him.

And we elected this man, Mr. Cheney, our Vice-President - twice!  Shame on us.  Thanks Mr. Bush for your patriotism and what Cheney calls "outstanding leadership"!  It would be very interesting if Cheney could be water-boarded for finding facts that he claimed (70 times?)when he was Vice-President, that he did not remember. Bush gave us Cheney and McCain gave us Palin.  Hmmm they love our country!
Cheney would've bombed his mother's summer home if he thought it would increase oil profits and the Haliburton bottom line.

last week , under obama the commander in chief, our president has extended our stay in iraq and afghanistan both for another 10 years or more; putting cheney's dream of invasion into a permanent occupation that the u.s. will seek to extend indefinitely, until the u.s. is totally broke , and has a financial catastrophe like argentina and russia both had ten years ago.

the military is so hopefully tied into the oil company racket, the 'advanced weapons' racket' , and the blind patriotic support of private defense contractors, racket, that they can no longer effectively plan for the sustainable future of the american strategic spheres of influence.

usually this leads to war or , in the face of an inability to make war, abdication of power.---thats' what happened to the soviet union.
Fears? Not every sexual assault case follows a script pulled off the set of Law & Order. This is not news, it's Op-Ed.
The gender bias is palatable.  Disputing the presumption of male guilt somehow victimizes women.  As we mature as a society perhaps we may provide equality for both genders.

I expect considerable pushback against advocates like this now.  They will be difficult to defund, they have their mouth deep around government teats, but I suspect their organizations will see contributions drop precipitously.  I think this is the turning point.

The evidence from the psychology labs as well as the experiences of those from the law enforcement community have demonstrated just how misguided it is to treat eyewitness testimony as a privileged source of evidence.

It's not that merchants won't allow cell phone transactions it's on the banks and the handset/OS makers to get the proper software so that you can use your cards. The tech is already in any store that let's you tap to pay with a RFID CC (7-11, CVS, any NYC taxi, etc). Someday it will all come together.

After years of toddling along with my 2004 something-or-other cell, (not a smartphone by any means, but good enough to make the one or two calls a month that needed doing) I fell in love at first sight with the Blackberry Torch. Love it! I really don't care that much about having one billion downloaded apps - when I'm on my phone, I'm either making a call, or checking out the latest news - which the Torch does wonderfully. It also takes amazing photos. I do hope Blackberry survives. Their Torch finally enticed me to ante up for more than just my old jalopy of a phone and to join the 21st century.

When I read the following line..."But such a sweeping change could face opposition from the regulator who oversees Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, and from INVESTORS in government-backed mortgage bonds..."  I couldn't help but think that this legislation will have no chance of passing because the rich (aka "investors") will no longer be able to rape the american people if it passes.

This should have been done 3 years ago! Fannie Mae underwriters refused my modification 3 times as well as a refinance with additional money I'd pay on the principal. After the appraisal I paid for through Citi- my home was worth more than I owed but the underwriters refused saying I didn't have enough equity and sent me to mod. dept. who claimed my home was worth 150K more than I owed and I had too much equity. After 3 yrs. of wage losses and using credit to make ends meet, I'm giving them the keys. They will be dishonest no matter what program is put into effect! Obama should have bailed them out only if they gave HARP to people. These crooks will do no better no matter what program is tried. At this point people are either homeless or near so and will not be able to apply for any new program. It is just too late.

This was a terrible idea back in 2008 when it was hatched and even a worse one today. In '08 the authors claimed that refinancing mortgage rates down to 5.25% would halt foreclosures and stop the housing depression. Today rates are at 4.2% and the beat goes on. All this misguided plan would do is transfer the liabilities of underwater homeowners to taxpayers and lengthen the housing downturn by years. If the government ever got out of the way and allowed the market to determine housing prices, a sustainable recovery could manifest.

A response to Mayer/Hubbard in 2008:

http://theaffordablemortgagedepression.com/2008/11/06/response-to-wsj-ar...

Jobs had a sense of craft rare in the American world of industrial design. In a well-known graduation speech at Stanford he talked of his days hanging at in Reed College's calligraph­y studio after dropping out. At the time Reed (which I attended) had one of the best calligraph­y programs in the country. One could even major in it. Jobs' love of lettering led him to offer fonts on the early Apple computers. So he combined inspiratio­n from an archaic practice with high technology­. Most American tech products focus on a raw functional look but Jobs focused on beauty - the iphone - when it came out was an object of desire if nothing else. A magical box in which the icons floated as if on a liquid film.  Unprecedented ergonomics. Years ago I read that Steve took his designers to visit Frank Lloyd Wright's Falling Water to teach them about design. Most Americans are divided between accepting the modern and a pull towards a nostalgic past. Consider "tradition­al" architectu­re versus modern. But Steve's approach is more like the Japanese, marrying a deep sense of craft (like the joinery in a Zen temple) with modern techniques to create the new object. He is a rare great American designer who reshaped the world.

The problem remains this program will protect the GOV'T GSE backed loans, with the privately held mortgages and the homeowners at risk cause they're not eligible and out to twist in the wind..... which I DO understand, BUT will still leave potential underwater props at risk - which will still leave some dark shadows on the market .

This administration and their trusted advisors continue to play favorites.

@ 20,

I know, I know, it sounds crazy, but Obama was not our President in 2007, and not in 2008 either.

Please please please please please just leave the housing market alone for a moment. All government plans seem to be aimed at getting people to stay in homes they can't afford. Let the market work for a while, free of interference. The prices may (will) drop, and there will be winners and losers. But, everyone will be able to move on!
Another program to keep people in homes means the generation behind them remain renters!
It is time the Feds tell Congress it is up to them because they have done all they can do.  It is time Congress went to work
What about the millions who have already lost their homes?  What about them?  It is outrageous that this administration has waited so long before even considering a meaningful effort to help.

Look, people, this is for mortgages that ARE ALREADY GUARANTEED BY THE GOVERNMENT.  The only reason NOT to refinance them is to help the banks.  It's not perfect, but it's a start.  It's crazy that banks are denying refinancing because of credit risk on a loan at a lower rate where the original and the refi are guaranteed by the government.

The greedy unethical banks and rating companies caused this mess so let them pay for it.  Throw everyone of their CEOs in prison and confiscate their ill gotten wealth.  That would be a good first start at making us a nation of laws again.

I love the right wing comments begging to let the free unregulated markets work when it is the unregulated free market that got us into this mess.  Don't they ever learn anything?  No wonder many conservatives still believe the earth is 6000 years old and man rode on dinosaurs.
I'm still looking at this proposed program and I just can't see how it can be gamed by the banksters; therefore, I believe it is just a pipe dream.
The guy is almost literally heartless, and yet, he´s still there... I don´t get it.
Is it me, or is it the result of a book being split among four reporters for a recap, but this sounds like the dullest memoir ever written.
